lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you guys so much for joining us. Excited to have you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So awesome.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Slightly nervous.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I know. I'm just telling you, if there's dice you really love, you might want to put them away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll just kiester this one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's my announcement. Anyone else have anything they want to mention?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah. I recently started my own Twitch stream. So you can follow me and watch. I play a lot of video games, guys. It's horrible addiction that's amazing. But it's @orionacaba on Twitch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You keep streaming Thursdays at 7:00, which I think is really counterproductive.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's weird.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: When you've mastered being in two places at once, it's silly not to take advantage of it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I am actually hosting Geek and Sundry on my channel right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, look at you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you simultaneously brewing at home right now?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I am. And I am also running this game in an alternate universe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh. Wow.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: It's pretty great. Yeah. And Matt rolls so bad in that game. It's really great. I am having dinner with my wife tomorrow so I'm looking forward to that. We're probably going to put a whole chicken in the smoker in the afternoon and then I think we're going to play some games. I'm introducing her to a game that I got at Gen Con called Lanterns.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lanterns?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, really fun Dom Lux game. Really like it a lot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll have to check that out.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I, after four lovely years, popped the question last week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you did.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Thank you very much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say Susan's a very lucky girl, but really, it's the other way around.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: No, I'm the lucky one. I lucked out. I really was the one who lucked out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does she know or is this the proposal?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I was going to propose like this, but we live in the woods and we don't get this show there. We have no internet whatsoever. No, she knows. She knows. She stupidly said yes, so we'll see what happens next.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: If you need an entree into the Society of Men Who Married Way Above Their Stations, I can provide you an introduction.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Thank you. (laughs) That's awesome. Yes, that is absolutely what happened here, so I will need that.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, they're members-only jackets.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Members-only jackets.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: The sleeves are little too short on all of the jackets, so we remember.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That's perfect. I like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A lot of suede.

lines.name: WILL, WIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: And a nylon hood zipped into the neck, for some reason.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which no one ever uses, and you forget it's there until you're like, "What's that? Oh, right." Congratulations.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Thank you. You are the first to know that that's happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Exclusive. Critical Role exclusive. Well, fantastic. Let's go ahead and jump into where we left off.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I thought I just heard you say you need a pencil.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yeah, I do.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'll share, if you'd like.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyone else need a pencil? Everyone good?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That was a good throw and catch.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I have a mechanical pencil that looks like a pencil pencil.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I think I have the same kind of pencil.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, it's nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We do the hand-eye coordination thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, guys. As it currently stands, Vox Machina throughout its ventures found itself in the city of Vasselheim, as of late. They came to seal away the Horn of Orcus they had tore from the head of the beholder K'Varn deep in the Underdark. Once they had completed this journey, they spent some time in the city trying to figure out what can be done there, preparation for possibly Keyleth making a venture out to one of her Ashari tribes. During which, Grog entered a fight ring and lost. And the party decided to go ahead and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never forget.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Basically, they were given the choice: they could go to trial or they could undergo their own personal trial to join the guild, the Slayer's Take, which is essentially a guild that takes on contracts to hunt various requested creatures down, harvest elements of their physical bodies to then be sold or returned to these individuals and be paid for it. If they manage to complete these trials, they will be absolved of breaking the law because they will now be within the confines of it and will be members of the guild. So choosing that, they were then also notified that they would be splitting up into two different groups, much to the chagrin of Vex and Vax, our twins.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Split apart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Separation anxiety is a real thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So this group, the second adventuring group, has gathered itself back to the Bellows' Respite inn. Vax, you were asked to go the bar, to join your sister, Vex, for a shot of the hardest liquor they had available to deal with the coming separation. You shared a brief breakfast, shared your bitter, spiteful, alcoholic imbibement, and then went your separate ways. The first group went initially, and it's been about an hour or so of you guys waiting in the tavern for them to, as far as you know, take care of their business before you were to go to the guild yourselves. So, we have Tiberius, Keyleth, and Vax all sitting around the Bellows' Respite tavern lamenting what's going to come next.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I've never seen you quite so down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not too bad.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It took you years to do that. I'm two minutes in, so I'll grieve a little bit longer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't say the word grieve. That's strong.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And no one has. So, you know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Separation makes the heart grow fonder and all that stuff.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's fine. I just have a low tolerance for bullshit, and I'd like to get past this little piece of shit that we're being made to swallow.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I agree. Stormwinds should not be meddling around with these peasants. Are we in a tavern?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are currently in the Bellows' Respite Tavern.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Barkeep, bring me your finest ale for my friend here and for the lady. I'll take a water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The relatively jovial, ginger-bearded, rotund human gentleman who runs the establishment comes over to you. Looks like himself is a little bleary-eyed and hasn't quite adjusted to the morning light itself. "Oh okay. Certainly, I'll go ahead and retrieve that for you. It's three? Three "is what I'm looking at?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, I'd say it's roughly 9:00 to 10:00 in the morning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh sure. Let's start early. Why not?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And I flip him a couple of gold coins.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He tries to catch it, fumbles. Goes and pick it up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't throw. That's rude.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five minutes go by. Your food and drink are brought to your table, and you continue to lament about the coming time. Is there anything else you guys wish to take care of before you make your way to the Slayer's Take Guildhall?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, since we're getting separated, Grog is taking the Bag of Holding.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I have one; don't forget that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, but we had a lot of stuff in that Bag of Holding. I kept most of the stuff that I needed on me, but how many healing potions do we have?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We lost our meat shield and we don't have Pike. So I think we probably need to go and get some potions.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can go ahead and brush up on healing spells, as well. Make sure I come a little bit more well-equipped, just in case.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm good on potions, but we should restock our supply.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many have you got?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I have, let me see here, three potions of greater healing, and three regular potions of healing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I have one?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I suppose. If we're just going to buy more, it doesn't matter. But just in case something happens along the way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I only have one greater healing potion right now.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, so we'll go buy more. And then we'll see what else they have. I would like to see if we can procure a couple of items, like a couple of empty vials. I've used a lot of mine. Maybe find some acid or whatnot at these item shops. So let's look around and get the stuff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Apparently we have the flying carpet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we have the flying carpet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The flying carpet is, for the most part, kept wrapped up in Grog's Bag of Holding.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's breaking up a little bit. But I feel like he just told me that we took the flying carpet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's very far away, but I feel it's reaching its limits.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (imitating Grog) I would like to bogart the flying carpet and everything in the fucking Bag.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He apparently left us with the flying carpet?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He's saying he left with the flying carpet, Keyleth. He left with it. We don't have it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He said, remember, you took the flying carpet. To break RP for a second.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (imitating Grog) Am I texting you that right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I can't. You're cutting out. You're cutting out, Grog.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I held it for a time, but I only have my Wheel of Mending in mine, as far as I know. Hold on, let me check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you reach into your Bag of Holding--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm thinking really hard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Through the luck of the draw, it seems to be that the last resting place of the flying carpet was within your Bag of Holding.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hold on. Oh here it is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, look at that. We have it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Shut my mouth. I guess I was wrong.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Found it. We're good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, let's go to the store. I don't really want to drag this out any longer than we have to. And I walk out the door and start going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What did you roll for your investigation check, Tiberius?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Amongst many of these barkers, you do catch one small tent, Tiberius, that catches your eye because it resembles the same purple color as one tent you guys entered in Emon about a year or so ago, in which you encountered a fortune teller.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit! It's the Witch's Fortune. What are you looking for?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Look at those fingers fly.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I approach.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know her name? Remember her name? I can probably find it. It would take a minute of digging, through. Hang on. I've got to go back to my old notes. I've got to go back to my old D&D notes. Keep doing stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you enter the tent, you pull the curtains apart. There is one other individual who seems to be just perusing the interior. But the smell that hits you immediately is very heavy sage, ceremonial burning of various spices, giving the area a mystical scent. The light itself is very low, just a few flickering candles and a hooded lantern in the far corner directed outward give a bit of ambiance to the interior of the tent. The series of small ropes and cords made of hemp and silk carry trinkets and bones and various enchanted accoutrements. And in the far back corner, amongst the table there is indeed a very beautiful elven woman dressed in a fine silk gown with a metallic headband, her dirty blonde hair behind her ears. And she looks to be in the middle of shuffling a deck of tarot cards. As you enter, she looks up and gives you a look of surprise and then a curious look of remembrance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Am I with him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He entered. Did you guys want to go in with him?

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you enter and are greeted by this same atmosphere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps) Trista!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gives you a cross look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's been so long! Fancy meeting you here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Trista's my sister."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're Forsythia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's good to see you again, young half-elf." You can see now with the current atmosphere, the light seems to dim the interior of the tent. And the elven woman's visage shimmers and then fades and there sitting behind the table you see a large, hunched forward, gnarled humanoid. This woman, who is definitively referred to as a hag, is currently lording over the table, long, twisted fingers holding that same deck of cards. Looking up at you with a crooked nose and pointed chin. There's a grin on her face. And looks to you and, "It has "been some time, dragonborn. I can still see there is a fraction of you still missing."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But I am actually happy to see you, milady.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still shuffling her cards. "So was there anything I can help you with?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes. Yes, there is. You mentioned before, when I asked you last, of the Boros Ring. You revealed that it was in the Fey, the Wild Fen. I am also in search of the item that I did not get to ask you about called the Pale Stone. I wish to know the location of that, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She gives you a keen look. "I think for the time being, one quest is enough. Return when you've "procured this ring you so graciously seek, then perhaps the rest of this will be revealed. Grow "greedy with fate and I fear the timeline will swallow you up, young dragonblood." She pulls the cards down and just starts going over her own reading. Each card she slams down with a heavy thud. The room seems to almost cloud, the air growing thicker. And there's a hint of frustration that she's currently being bothered and strung out. After she takes a few moments to herself, she looks back you. "Is there business you seek, aside from asking me these questions? Perhaps a bauble "or two. I make fine baubles."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Since you're not in the business of information, then we are in the business of procuring some specific items. Potions. I'm looking for a few empty glass vials. Perhaps some acid, if you have it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She stands up. And as she stands up, you can now see the hag, which hunched forward, sits at a solid five feet tall. At full height, even with the hunch, she's now cresting the top of the tent at seven feet. Long, stringy, gray-black hair framing the shoulders. The same nice goldish silk outfit the elf appearance was wearing is there. It looks much more world-tattered and matches the one currently wearing it. She reaches behind her, still staring you intently in the face, and grabs a small case off the wall. Sets it down before her. Pulls back the wooden lid and inside, you can see there are three small glass vials. "These are what I have to offer. Two of them will right your "physical form, perhaps take care of some of those wounds someone as foolish and careless as you "eventually deal with. The third one is caustic in its nature. Its application is up to you. They are "sold as a set, though. 300 gold pieces. Take it or leave."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You don't have to be all nasty about it. I have the money. Here you go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you realize, she's far older than you ever gave her credit for. She pulls the bag of coin from your hand and withdraws. The light seems to return from the peripheral of your vision. Keyleth and Vax are there at your side. She reaches forward and pushes the box forward toward you on the table. "Be safe, and may fortune smile upon "most of you."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, I know something bad is going to happen. I show them the box. I take it and pick it up. This is all she had to offer. She's not taking questions.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're not taking any questions right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not today."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not today?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As you know, my dealings with fate take a lot out of me. I'm not quite ready for another "round of tellings. You see, this city, as most bits of civilization, are very eager to hear what "the future has in store for them. So I'm a bit tapped out at the moment." And you can see a bit of dried blood around one of her nostrils. And if you recall last time, the process was very physically taxing on her. "Perhaps return in a week or so. And if I'm not here, I'm around."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Old one, are you still willing to trade today?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Trade?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm wondering if you have any poisons beyond the run-of-the-mill nightshades this afternoon or morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you see it's cracked and old and it's been brutalized. And she pulls a very small vial of some dark, black, almost umbra-type liquid where you can't even see shine in the light. It absorbs all the light. She puts it forward. "This would be very unfortunate to find its way into the "bloodstream of an enemy, yes?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you want for it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A favor. Not now, but perhaps down the road."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: She does that, Vax. A lot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She pushes it forward with her long, crooked fingernail, shoves the vial forward. It screeches across the top of the table. She withdraws her hand. "So it is done." At that moment, there's a very a cold shiver down the back of your neck that then fades. She just grins with this nasty, toothy grin. "Now, be on your way. I have cards to shuffle."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yoink.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was so nice to see a familiar face in such a strange place. She's lovely.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes. Good day, madam.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you step out, she raises her hand in front of her and her form once again shimmers and shifts down to that beautiful elven maiden that greeted you as you entered. The lights tend to blossom a little bit and you close the tent behind you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As we're leaving, I say, that's a good look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gives a slight breathy chuckle that starts beautiful. (chuckle turns into a cackle)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What did we actually get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You acquired two potions of greater healing, and a vial of caustic liquid. You are uncertain as to what its properties are.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caustic liquid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also don't quite know the properties of yours, but you gather, the assurance from a creature of this power, that she speaks in riddles, but not in untruths.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to give you another one of the greater potions. So mark that down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. We're right in the middle of the bazaar. Do we want to take a quick jog around? I grab someone passing by and say, you, potions? Where? Here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The person looks down at your arm, brushes it off, and the middle-aged gentleman goes, "Sir, you do realize that most of the potion trade is controlled by the clergy?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're all like no magic and stuff here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did not know that. Thank you. Well, shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. Did he say that it was controlled by the clergy?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So we should go there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on. Just because it is controlled by the clergy doesn't mean that it's legal. Doesn't mean that if we go knocking on their door requesting potions that they're going to take kindly to that. Kind of like getting your concealed deadly weapons license in certain places.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you point us in the right direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The individual looks at you awkwardly and points over. And you can see just past the outskirts of this bazaar, there are a number of buildings that line the outer area of this central portion. You can see where he is pointing, there is a large cathedral made of almost, from this distance, a warbling, warped obsidian, and it is far more ominous and obelisk-like in appearance than the other temples. In a district of the city that you haven't been to yet. But it is the closest temple.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Warbling Obsidian is my Black Crowes cover band.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm getting itchy. Can we just go to the Take please?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn and I lean into Tiberius and I say, he's going to be cranky the entire time we're on this field trip, isn't he?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, and usually I'm the cranky one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So let's head to the temple. Right? Yes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can you turn into a horse?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, but that's a little forward, don't you think?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm just asking.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we going to the temple or the Take?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, the Take? What would make you feel better?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's get on with it, shall we? Jesus, whoever that is.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That was that one carpenter we met in in Vasselheim.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, he was sweet. He had some good herb.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, he did. He sure knew how to-- it was dank.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dank," which is arcane terms for "thaumaturgical." Anyway. You make your way to the southern outskirts of this portion of the bazaar, which leads its way into the central building cluster portion of the Quad Roads district to the outside of the Slayer's Take Guildhall. You walk up to the main doorway which has the inscription in front. And pushing the door open, you enter into the main foyer area, where you see the same cast-iron chandeliers hanging from the ceiling, the dark wood rafters frame the entire internal area. And there sitting at the central desk is Mertin, the scarred-up halfling with the relatively joyful disposition. He looks up from his books. "Okay, it appears to me that we have the other half of this adventuring group to deal "with. Let us hope that perhaps you have better luck than your previous friends in what has been "chosen for you, eh?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They already headed out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, they left not more than an hour ago, I imagine."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And what were they contracted with?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, nothing. They're going to kill a dragon. Would you like "me to go get the mistress for you?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll take that as a yes. I'll be right back." And he gets up from his table and wanders off.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: They'll be fine. I'm sure of it. Scanlan makes good decisions all the time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you hear the familiar footsteps of the Huntmaster, Vanessa Cyndrial. Her tiefling appearance both very striking in her chiseled bone structure in her face, her dark leather armor itself creaking slightly with each footstep. And she has that very commanding yet welcoming appearance, which you know hides a very hard-to-read interior. She steps forward. "Well, are you ready to take on the other half of this "mission? Your friends were eager. And they traveled with some of our finer warriors. Are you "confident in your capabilities today?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Listen, don't be smug with me. None of us what to be here or cooperate with this stupid event just to abide your laws.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tiberius, we could be on trial.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: The answer is yes. Let's get on with it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You see, it is very simple. I like it, direct and to the point. I respect that."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. Well, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you have one other hopeful for this guild that will be joining you for this, and a leader "will be assigned to you on this excursion to keep an eye on you and make sure you stay within the rules and "not go absconding to some other country and we have to hunt you down."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fantastic.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Can we use the word liaison?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Kashaw, your group has arrived."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: (sighs) He walks out and meets everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys look, the door opens, and a human male steps out into the light. If you wish to describe yourself.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I am Kashaw Vesh, an acolyte. Here I am, waiting for you for so long now. Do I have to travel with them the entire time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For the remainder of this contract at least. But once you have joined the Guild, perhaps "other groups will be assigned to you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, were we late? We didn't mean to keep you waiting. Or do you mean like, you've been waiting for us for a long time in the destiny, "we're here and where have you been my whole life" kind of way?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Is she always like this?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, she is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not good at reading emotions.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: This is going to be fun. Yes. No, I meant you're late.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. Is that what people say about me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll talk later.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax'ildan.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I am Tiberius Stormwind.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: A dragonborn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's your thing? What do you do?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What I do is not really important. What I want to get done, I think, is what matters. What I want to do is start this quest. Is that what you called it? Quest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is a contract."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: A contract, a job. Can we just get out there, please, and do what we have to do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I agree. Let's hurry it up, Merkin. Shall we?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That wasn't your name, was it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's Mertin. Mertin is the name. But it's okay."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can hear accent from upbringing. It's Syngornian use. It's fine. Mertin. Never mind." By the way, the human that has walked out, you can see has shoulder-length brown hair, a leather cord that is tied around the center of the forehead. Eyes two different colors. One I believe is a light blue?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: And his right arm, all the way up from where you can see where it disappears below the armor is covered in one-inch cuts, with scars all the way up.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Ah, a religious man.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mertin goes over and knocks on a door, opens it up. This individual is easy to hear from a distance. The heavy footfalls and the grumbling echoes through the hallways before he even appears. Mertin leads you into the light of the main foyer area. "This will be the group of which "you will be guiding on this. I appreciate you doing this for us. I know it's not really usually "what you do. But here is your team for this contract."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm sorry, where is the team?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is your team." And Vanessa chuckles to herself. "I'm sorry. This is what you'll be dealing with today."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hello, I'm Tiberius Stormwind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now Thorbir, play nice."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thorbir. Thorbir, play nice."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Do any of you speak Dwarven?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: And you can see that he's got Dwarven script written in tattoos all the way down his right arm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So please, if you would not mind making sure that they see their contract to fruition, "taking them on this as you will, showing them the ropes of the guild, and try not get them killed."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: And for me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you will be rewarded as per the contract. You will have done the guild a great "favor, which you know favors can go a very long way in the guild."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I certainly do. You don't have to tell me about repaying favors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fair enough. Well, perhaps now would be a good time for this jovial lot of adventurers to "know what it is they are to hunt down."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Is it an actual group?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, we'll see how well you can make it into one. Perhaps this is a test for you as well, "fair dwarf."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think is going to be an excellent bonding experience.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Seriously, the whole time she is like this?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, she is. It grows on you, though.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: So does the plague.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone has such a problem with optimism.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you wouldn't mind reading, half-elf."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know, public speaking is not really my strong suit. Okay. Ordered and paid in advance by anonymous.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, they're a fun group.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This contract, binding in honor and the elements, sets upon the agreed members of the Slayer's Take Guildhall, and the task of locating and slaying the below-mentioned entity, and the recovery of the below-listed harvested anatomy items. And any anatomy items not recovered or not in functional condition will be deducted from the final payment and refunded to the client. Oh. This contract is good for three days and should the contract not be fulfilled within that time period, all payments are null and void, this contract is null and void, and membership of the Slayer's Take is revoked-- outside of the Huntmaster's willful forgiveness.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Skip to the punchline.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The quarry has been approved for hunting by the Holy Paramours of the Crown of Erathis. The quarry of one rakshasa. What's a rakshasa?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tiger man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tiger man?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Essentially.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: How do you know that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Storybooks in Syngorn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We need two rakshasa eyes, one rakshasa tongue, one rakshasa heart, two rakshasa claws, and two rakshasa canine teeth. So canine.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Would this be an arcana or this be a history check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be more of an arcana check.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm going to do an arcana check. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18? Rakshasas were entities that originally stemmed from the realm of the Nine Hells. They are devils. They are deceptive, and usually embed themselves in elements of society where they can grasp and take power. They love having servitude beneath them, and they are notoriously difficult and slippery to find, let alone nail down and destroy. Appearance-wise, they look like a normal humanoid man, but have the face of a tiger, and the other curious element is both of their hands are reversed. That's as much as you can glean from your formal training and understanding.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does this cat have a name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why does it matter? All we know is we can confirm that there is one within the vicinity, "or huntable at the very least. The rest is up to you to find."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The quarry is where it's been last located? Oh, okay. Yeah, you double-check it. I might have missed something.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Why can't we know who the client is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The client has decided they wish to remain anonymous for this contract."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: This seems to be bothering you, Kashaw.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Everything's been bothering me lately. She's not helping. Do you want to read this?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's going to say the same thing. Which part?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Give me this. How far to the quarry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Your quarry is the creature."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You said it was in the vicinity. What are we talking "in the vicinity?" Are we talking a day's hike? We talking an hour from here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Meaning, we've been able to confirm that there is one that is within a huntable distance "within the three days of the contract. However, part of this trial is to see just how good you are "at finding and destroying such creatures, so that information is for you to find, unless you do not "feel your skills are up to par for the Slayer's Take, in which case, you are more than welcome to "go for the door, human."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you have no further information? Are there any grumpkins you want us to find? Do you expect us to go out with no information at all to find a man with a tiger's head?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You seem to have done well enough to find and "destroy great things you spoke of as you walked into these halls. Prove to me that you are more "than just sell-swords. Show to me that you have the intellect, that you have the skill sets, that "you have the cleverness to find the creature that does not wish to be found."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this how things normally go around here?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Normally, I don't waste my time with the likes of you. Man with a tiger's head is going to stand out. No problem finding him. Let's stand here and talk about this forever, or let's head out and get this over with.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, dwarf, why don't you do your title and lead then? And I should warn you, you are walking with a Stormwind. You may not know my name, but I can assure you, I alone am an army, so we are well protected. So, lead us to find this tiger-man, please.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Dragonborn is a lot of talk.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: If he's an army, why not just send him out?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was probably the ballsiest thing you've ever said.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: All right, Storm?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wind. People call me Tibsy.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Let's see how good you are at following. And he heads out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's not very good. Oh, he's gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Outside of the Slayer's Take into the center of the main Quad Roads thoroughfare, on the outskirts of the bazaar to seek a rakshasa, wherever one may be found.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought this was going to be a fun field trip.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Rakshasa!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It does. It is a tiger person, so maybe we can relate.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I want to switch teams.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, it gets better.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's your name again? I'm sorry.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Everyone else does.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kash. Brother Kash, are you new to the Guild, as well?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'm not a member of the Guild yet. I had something happen with someone who did something and now I'm here. Why don't we leave it at that, for now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's how we got here.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Apparently, I only have to be here for another three days, which will be good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm impatient. Perception 20. Is there anything around that indicates where, which of these four directions is the best direction to go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Knowing the city for the while that you've been here, you know there are places of open business that have a lot of traffic are also good places to ask for if anyone has seen anything that might match a certain description, or an individual that you are seeking, any strange behavior. And so you know that the center of the Quad Roads where that bazaar is, is a good place to start requesting information as you have currently none at your disposal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just to get this clear, a rakshasa's not a beast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a man.

lines.name: WILL, ORION
lines.text: It's a demon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a demon creature that looks like a man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But it's not a beast, by definition?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry. I'd like to make an insight check on the dwarf, not to see if he is lying, but he could be. Can I get a gut instinct into what his deal is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an insight check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three, but I'm going to use my Luck to try that again. 18 plus two is 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Would you like to go ahead and roll a 20?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just reinforce the myth, man.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: That's one better than I usually roll. I'd say it's twice as good as I usually do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gruff exterior. There is definitely a toughened past to him. He seems driven. Not necessarily untrustworthy, per se, but definitely a man of little patience and currently does not seem to be too pleased with the fact that he's essentially babysitting, in his mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there a marshmallow center?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may find out in due time. Yet that is too hard to read at this moment.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: If you're in the bazaar, do I have to be out of the city to cast Locate Creature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can cast that anywhere you want to. Your magic is divine. This is your city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And that's not just a descriptor, either.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Thank you. It's normally fabulous, but not in this city. So then how do I go about casting Locate Creature?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can just tell me.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I'd like to go ahead and cast Locate Creature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking at the specifics of the spell to make sure that I don't give you misinformation... Locate Creature. Beautiful.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You guys have jazz hands.

lines.name: ORION, WILL
lines.text: Rakshasa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's faint, which means that it is on the outskirts. And you know this lasts for a good thousand feet or so. But it does give you a northeastern direction. And the spell fades.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Northeastern direction.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: We should go northeast. It is also unfortunately, or fortunately, depending on how you look at it, closer than we thought.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the walls of the city?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Not in the walls, but very close to them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have any type of plan of attack? Does anyone know how to fight these things? Any earthly clue?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Leader boy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Leader boy?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm sorry, are you talking to me?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Thorbir is what they meant to say.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Listen to Stormfather over here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take my social cues from other people. I'm sorry.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: In my experience, there has not been a problem invented that can't be solved with an axe.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's true. We've seen that.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Wonderfully helpful. Thank you.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Follow the axe.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Now what I want you to do is imagine an hourglass. You got that? Good picture of an hourglass in your heads? See all that sand draining out? Let's get a move on.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Okay. What am I doing with this sand?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree with that. Are we supposed to do something with the sand?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, count it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that would take so long. Can we tag-team this?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: She always like this?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Stormcloud's counting sand. I don't know what she's doing over here. Northeast. How about let's start walking that way and see what happens? Can we give that a shot?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I agree. You did the fancy spell.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It's not as fancy as you might think.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I've pulled my axe out and I'm sort of holding it like a walking stick. And just very deliberately, very demonstratively walking ahead in that direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With each footfall, you know that what was once, probably hundreds of years ago, a nice cobblestone roadway in the center of the city has been slowly hit with mud, dirt, snow, sleet, and so each step is a slight moisture with each footfall.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm assuming there's no stables around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not immediately, those are usually to the very outside of the city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why are you jonesing for a horse?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: So I don't get all dirty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That being probably Raven's Crest, which is the main temple to the Raven Queen. This is also where the Amaranthine Oubliette is located, which is essentially the prison of the entire city of Vasselheim.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Amaranthine Oubliette.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hammertime oubliette.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, there it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Far enough away from the oubliette to the point where isn't crossover and is enough of an escape, because that apparently has happened in the past history of the city. As you begin pushing towards the edge of where the two districts meet, you can see that there is an area of the town that, for lack of better term, it's a more jovial than expected area. There are a series of stands put up along the side of the road. There's a lot of beggars sitting on the side of the street that are currently panhandling to those who walk by. There are a number of taverns. You can hear music coming from various establishments. And it seems almost the closer you get to the death-oriented district on the border of the Quad Roads, the more and more it pushes into a shadier Mardi Gras-type experience. So you make your way towards that dividing line there. What you would like to do?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: What say you, Thorbir?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Let's ask around and see if anything has been a little out the ordinary, or maybe, in the ordinary.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, I like that phrasing.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Have to imagine anywhere this thing goes, there's going to be strange deaths associated with it. We might as well look there.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That's actually a good idea, as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And where we're walking, are there shops and stands, as well, or is it residential?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are many that sell jewelry, many that sell very well-made clothing, some of them party attire, there are some that sell exotic fruits that have been imported in various states of ripeness.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is anyone selling any masks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Passive or active?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be an active perception check as you're seeking it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't seem to have too many customers right now, but they do have a couple of masks that are on display.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any masks that look like tiger masks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking at it, there are none that are tiger-specific, no. They seem to be molded leather and some more impish, goblin-y in appearance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there someone working the stand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is, yes. You see a woman in her forties or so, thin, with a big toothy smile. Her hair is pulled back into tight bun. You can see there's little bit of her blondish hair turning to gray on the sides around her ears, Reed Richard-style.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Did you say this was the Bahamut part of town, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Bahamut section is far away. That's another section of the city. You are now on the line between the Duskmeadow and the Quad Roads, so it's Erathis and the Raven Queen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm pulling a mask off the wall. This is a beautiful piece. Do you make them yourself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do. I do, I make them myself by hand, hence the price."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They are quite beautiful. We're travelers here. I've never seen a neighborhood like this. Is there a festival going on here, or is this pretty much the basic fare of the day here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you've been around Vasselheim long enough "you've seen there is little interest in celebration depending on some places. But, at "least on this line, some people can appreciate the fleetness that is life and grasp it by the roots "and make it its own before it's snuffed out."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is the norm around here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Consistently. That's why I come and bring my business here. I wouldn't do very well up "north, I'll tell you that. All them dragon types--" Looks to you. "No offense. All them "silver dragon lovers have an issue with things as celebratory."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I pull out ten gold, and I spread them on her desk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How many masks?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, none.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I would like one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Take your pick."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I slide one coin away from the other nine, and then dragging my finger across those say, is there anything out of the ordinary these days?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? She gives you a look like she's trying to read you, looks about left and right. Glances at you and looks a little ugh. Glances at you and looks really taken aback, and then comes back to you with a escape of comfort.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Watching her, I pull out another five and spread them in front of the first nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is one of the few areas in which the more adult pleasures can be "found, so there's a lot of money to be had. But recently, there's been, at least from what I've "heard, a series of bodies have turned up. There were a few found, fished out by the Bastions in "the water trough on the outskirts of the Duskmeadow."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Bastions: what are they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what I hear, they had been mauled by some "sort of strange beast."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mauled?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Now, beasts on the outside of the city, that I can see. But on the inside, that is the "stuff of nightmares. Is it not?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, I would agree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you had invaders like this before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, death is not an uncommon occurrence for certain areas of the city." And she gestures off to the distant temple. "Some people invite it, even. But such violent death like this is usually "kept to the outside of the city, at least with some sort of cause. This seems to be a murderous "rampage that, me personally, I don't want to go out at night without protection."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there is any indication of the cause of death on these corpses? How do they find them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perhaps you have to ask the Bastions yourself "that. Or anyone who was in the vicinity."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And can you point us in the right direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: People from the different clergies, the different temples, train to become Bastions, and fit themselves with whatever their deity's armor is. You do see there are two Bastions armored in a very dark, dark brown leather that carry a symbol of what looks like a silver raven that is embroidered on one shoulder of a cloak that is tossed to one side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These guys are right here, essentially?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Oh. They're across the road about maybe a block up. "I believe they're Bastions from "the Duskmeadow. Perhaps you could ask them."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does she have any masks that look like a raven? A raven mask?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She does actually have one that looks like a raven.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. A good choice. It doesn't quite match the color of your attire, but perhaps I have "an outfit that could match for you?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Oh my god, we're going clothes shopping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have a little cloak as well? A little cape?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They can probably help you there."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just pick it up and put it on and say, thank you, madam. Much obliged. And walk off and clap Thorbir on the shoulder and keep walking.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Thorbir hangs back a little bit and waits for them to get to the door. And he looks at the shop keep and, do you have any masks that might fit a little girl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, not many people bring children to this side of the district. They don't sell very "well. But if you would like one, I would be happy to part with for two gold?"

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: One gold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "One gold. Guess it is better to sell it than not at all. Here you are. I must say, I won't "tell anyone, but purple is a pretty color on you."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yes, it is. He walks out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. A few moments pass as you wonder where your dwarven leader has vanished to, he steps out through the front of the establishment.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Great. Do you have potions? Are you all potioned up? Are you good on items, Thorbir?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm all right. Are you all right?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm just fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we're in a rush, but if it's easy. How do you come by potions in this town?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Do I know the answer to that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. They're either provided, from some of your experience, by the Slayer's Take, but those are usually offered at the start of a contract. The fact that they weren't offered on this means either they don't have any currently at their disposal, or they felt that this contract probably wouldn't require it with the construct of this group being set out. Other than that, they are a little hard to come by. A lot of them are controlled by the main temples and are pretty much given straight to the Bastions. There aren't a lot of individuals that are in need of them within the city, and those that travel out are either members of the Slayer's Take or members of the Bastion forces. So they are little hard to come by.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I think that if we're going to find them anywhere, it might be around here. Might be we can take some through trade. Maybe some might fall off a Bastion or two.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Well, let's go talk to one then, shall we?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Thought that's what we were doing. Are going to the two Bastions over there or what?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes, Kashaw.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Good. One other thing you need to know about them: they're horribly paid, so money talks with these people.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Very well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As he goes ahead, I keep up my pace until I trail behind him a little bit.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Wonderful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My hood goes up, and I'm gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The hair itself is cut very short. A little heavier in appearance. A little muscle, a little layer of winter padding, but the black leather armor definitely gives you the appearance of somebody who is a Bastion of the Raven Queen. As you approach, the hooded half-elf, the dwarf walking with the giant axe, and the bumbling dragonborn, the human cleric with a very angry disposition, and the awkward half-elf druid stepping in pace with him. Gives you all a cursory look and immediately puts a hand to his side where you can see that there is a rapier currently sheathed. "Aye, you walk with purpose."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: We walk for the Guild.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Slayer's Take it is?"

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What business have you on this side of town, then? Aren't you supposed to be out past the "walls killing creatures and such?"

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Our business takes us where our business takes us. Our business brings us here today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, then what's your business?"

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: You might be having some trouble?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: What's causing you trouble and what's going to get us out of here might be the same thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The gentleman to the left of him finishes shaking off the rest of his alleyway journey.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Any more than twice and you're just playing with it, pal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are certain bits of business that are official in this town. I don't know how honestly "right it is to be talking with common folk, or even the Guild who does what it likes."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm sorry, you're not talking to common folk.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: He wants money.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I know what he wants.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Well, then give to him so we can get out of here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm circling around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm not even going to roll. I'm going to ask you to go ahead and you can choose if you want persuasion or intimidation on this. You're riding that line.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I'm equally bad at both of them. But I think that Thorbir wants to go intimidation. I'll give that a try. There it is!

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: What's the exact opposite of that? (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You know, I've heard about it for so long.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I know, right? You can't believe that it's a real thing until you're actually there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody talks about spontaneous combustion, but I'd never believed it.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: It's silly. It's so silly to do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dice shame.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Naughty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you lean forward--

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll get to that. As you lean forward, forcing your presence on this Bastion, his hand's still holding the edge of his rapier. He steps forward into you, to the point where you're almost forehead to forehead. "Sorry, I have to lean down to reach your level. But if you're going to go "about asking questions and not offering proper compensation for information, well, then. I think "we have no business here."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: If it's compensation you're looking for, let's just speak plain. And I pull out four gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And while he has their attention, I'm going to check out his pockets.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's better. That's all right. Perception, you said? 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28? Taking a moment as you sneak up behind the one he's talking to-- the two guys are shoulder to shoulder, squaring off with the rest of this group. The one that had been relieving himself in the alleyway is a little bit closer to you. You can see as he put his tunic right and everything, he jostled around and revealed a couple of small pouches on his side. One of which, you heard a clinking of glass on the inside. Go ahead and make a sleight-of-hand check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go rogue, go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because I'm wearing a Cloak of Elvenkind, which I know affects stealth checks but not--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not sleight of hand, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's all right. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you pull out the four gold from inside, the Bastion looks out and scoffs and goes, "Clearly, pittance fee for this. What's to let me think "that you aren't actually part of this murder scheme? You just walk up and try and start asking "questions like this. First off, where did you hear about it? Second, you look like the kind that "would go ahead and be mauling folks in the street, do you not, sir dwarf? You got the eyes of one "who's probably done a few dark deeds."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh, I have. More than you can imagine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then explain to me why we shouldn't take you in for questioning right now." And he pulls his rapier out.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Hold on. Everybody calm down. Hi, I'm Tiberius Stormwind. My friend Thorbir here didn't mean to offend, of course.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've got ten seconds before we take you in."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I reach into my pocket and rattle my coins around a little bit. Maybe I could buy us some time. And I drop ten gold out into my other hand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion roll.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: One! No, it isn't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: So that's going to be a six. Guys, I think we're fighting the Bastions. I feel like maybe it's going that way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You rolled a one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I rolled one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You all have really low self-confidence.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, look. I'll tell you what we know. But "if you're going to be messing around with this investigation, I ask that you don't let anyone "know that you spoke with us. This is all on your own. And if you do say anything, we'll deny it and "we'll make sure to put you in the Oubliette yourself for this. All right?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: WIL, WILL
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's well-known in these parts as bringing in a lot of business. His caravans come through via "various skyships. And he brings with himself an influx of much-needed mercantile in the city."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's his name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm not allowed to say."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You're not allowed to say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The merchant's name is Tyrell."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disappeared. No longer in his sight. No tracks "left behind. Just gone. Didn't know if it was angry poltergeist, ghost. But the last place he "was staying is at a recent establishment, only been here a couple of years. Referred to as "the Velvet Cabaret. The Velvet Cabaret is a very high-end place."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I know it well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You do?" He gives you a look of--

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I've heard about it from somewhere else.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Scanlan? Have you been talking to Scanlan?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Don't know who that is, Stormshadow.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He likes whores. Okay. It's weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The fact that that the lord had been staying at the Velvet Cabaret for some time, and "we were feeling pretty close to possibly finding the source of these murders. Our bastion force "from the Duskmeadow worked with the Quadroads and we actually raided it. Found nothing. Nothing but "the patrons, no sign of any sort of foul play. We were forced to leave empty handed. That's all "we've got."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I have a question about the bodies. Have you seen them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've only seen the most recent. The rest, I've just heard of."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Anything similar with them? Are they all men? Are they all women? Are they children?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No children. Most of them seem to be well off to do folk. Dressed well."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Wealthy men and women? And you say you've searched everywhere, including the catacombs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's a nasty place to be staying."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It is, indeed.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Is there a way that the bastions could organize some kind of gathering of sorts? Perhaps a mandatory town meeting, where all would have to gather for maybe an announcement or something official?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The city's scattered politically enough as it "is. People can be rallying whenever there's some sort of force coming against the city. But when it "comes to nothing for any particular reason, just the investigators take care of it themselves."

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: He serves the Raven Queen, right? He's got the Raven Queen patch on him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: This part of town, death isn't the worst thing in the world. Lots of planes other than ours, might be you're a little bit closer than some of the rest of us are; we're underneath the mountain. You wouldn't happen to know about anyone performing any rituals or maybe opening up lines of communication that may have been made and disturbed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I certainly hope not. These sort of communion rituals are sanctified and held within "the actual temple to the Raven Queen itself. If anyone is doing any sort of business, there is a "very watchful eye over the city. Anything that is unsanctioned, "I can guarantee we'll know about it."

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: May we seek audience with this Raven Queen?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, she's a goddess.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh. She's not here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's not a queen. She's a goddess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the two the two bastions are looking at each other with expression of "Really?"

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: We're new around here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Listen, we've talked long enough. We got to get back to our posts."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, wait. You mentioned investigators?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There are different people assigned to investigate. We were part of the team that was "sent as part of the investigation raid on the Velvet Cabaret."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not a group of people. It's just, "you're an investigator today" kind of thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's part of what we do as Bastions, aye."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Gotcha. Is there anyone else that is part of the investigation team that you think would be good to talk to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They wouldn't have any more information than we do, no."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do an insight check on him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, go for it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But he doesn't seem to be covering anything necessarily.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Did he tell us where they found the-- I didn't write this down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And Lord Tyrell factored in how?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Can you tell us where you found the body of the merchant lord?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The body was found in the side alley to the Velvet Cabaret."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You said wrapped up? Or just the ones in the river were wrapped up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The ones that were found in the river, they were wrapped up in blankets. Whatever put them "aside was not some beast. There was some intelligence to this. And they were placed "deliberately, which means, I don't think there's just one thing doing this."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Were the blankets the same, or were they all different?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They seemed to be different. Some were just scattered cloths. Some were tattered sheets. Some "were bolts of fine material. Really varied. There was no pattern to it."

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Was anything missing from Lord Tyrell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nothing more than his throat, his trachea."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've pumped these guys for all they've got.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: You're all right. Sorry about that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're sanctified as a Slayer, but don't make us look bad." They step around you guys, back out into the main street.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Velvet Cabaret?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Velvet Cabaret.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It's close.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we know that this guy-- while we walk there, I was talking. We know that this guy is a demon from the Nine Hells. So, he seems to be targeting wealthy people. Do you think these are people that tried to get under his control, under his servitude, and it didn't go his way, so he ended up killing them?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Do we know anything about him? Does his name ring any bells for us at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a history check.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh boy. (laughs) It happened again!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is unprecedented. You are the nega-Percy right now.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Just telling you. I'm just telling you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is impressive.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: You think it isn't real. You think it's a thing I make jokes about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a moment to conjecture where you may have heard the name. What was the name again?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Oh, what was his name? Adama?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You want to roll a history check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: d20 and add your history modifier.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Add my history. 20. Total of 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total is 20? All right. You've heard of the city of Ank'Harel. It's a desert city from a long ways away. But you aren't specifically aware of this individual. You however, Kashaw, you know that Lord Tyrell has come through this city a few times in the past year or so. You've only been here a short time yourself, but in the time that you've been here, you've heard tales of this large caravan that comes through. And it is a parade. He usually brings with him a good 13 different carts that contain all sorts of jewels and materials and tapestries and fine silks, and it's almost a small party whenever this is this long walking caravan is brought into the city. So you are aware of this individual. You're surprised that the death has be kept so hush-hush.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: And are there rumors of about him bring in anything else? Anything illicit? Or is it kind of "what you see is what you get?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know? No information that has caught your ear per se, but the fact that he's staying in this district, who knows?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Folk tend to stay with their own class. These victims are all wealthy folk. And they seem to have the Velvet Cabaret in common. It's very likely that we're dealing with somebody who is rich and powerful.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What does a demon need money for?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Who says he's after money?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Seems to be after power.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tyrell was passing through. I wonder how many people would notice him gone here in Vasselheim.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm sure quite a few.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it seems like it's no secret when he comes to town.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It was a party every time he showed up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And according to the guards, these murders have been going on for the past few years, so it seems like whatever we're dealing with might have time to plan ahead. If he's been aware of the past few times that Tyrell has come through the town and could possibly know the next time he's coming through.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And if we could pinpoint when it actually started, we know years, but actually when, then we can actually narrow it down to the establishments and other things that were established then.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Would there be a place where we could inquire as to some sort of ledger like that when this guy comes in and with the intention of trying to correlate it with when different murders have happened? Actually, I take that back. Thorbir doesn't think that deeply. That's not the thing that he wants to do. That sounds like a lot of thinking and not a lot of hitting things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This killer could be hiding in plain sight at the Cabaret. Could be an employee there.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Or the owner himself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long ago did the bastions say that they raided the Velvet Cabaret?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: It was a month ago, wasn't it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was a few weeks back when the murder occurred, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So here's my question: do you think he would stick around after it was raided? Or do you think he'd move on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The thing is vanishing upon sight.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: And gotten away with it for the last two or three years. I don't think he cares much anymore.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My question is: we have three days, Cabaret's the only lead we have. How do we draw this person, he or she, out?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I believe it is three days.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have three days to collar it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have three days to complete the contract, meaning slaying the entity you're contracted to.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I was going to say that you look like a man who knows wealth.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've spent time with wealth.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Well, I never have, so I would think maybe if you were a merchant coming into town, very wealthy, looking for some adult entertainment, might be a way to bring him out the forefront.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You're half-elf right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Half-elves.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'll turn into a half-elf, akin to a high-born half elf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, fair enough. Even in comparison to Vax, your attire is very nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does this mean that I should go change clothes?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You were going to go shopping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You look okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go. I jingle what gold I have in a pouch in front of Keyleth's face and say, let's go shopping. Come on.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Shopping montage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys go out shopping for better looking, well-to-do attire, we'll go ahead and take a quick five-minute break and we'll return here and as you guys continue to the next step of your hunt for the rakshasa.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: What a silly thing to forget.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As the rakshasa bears down on your head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Last thing engraved on your tombstone. Yeah, quick five-minute break. First off, before we get to that, guys: A big thank you to Negihama once again, our patron saint of ridiculous gifts, who purchased these sconces to put on the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're legit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aren't the sconces awesome?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are amazing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The LEDs change colors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back. I assume we'll have a Liam here in just a moment.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: He's just stealthing.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: He's stealthing. He rolled a 28 and disappeared.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I was talking Liam's ear off during the break about how much I love the dynamic among the three of you, and commiserating about how you feel really naked and exposed when your whole party isn't together. How weird that feels to not have everybody together at the same time. I think I kept him from the bathroom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, gotcha. That's okay. He'll arrive. When he comes, we'll all awkwardly stare. Yeah. When he does. When he arrives we'll all just-- But in the meantime, you managed to go back and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I love the awkward stare. It was great.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: He's actually a very generous DM if he does that. I actually make my players roll damage when they upset me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's good to know.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, dude, d6 damage if you annoy the GM.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wrath of the gods comes down upon you. All right, so you guys taken a few minutes to acquire outfits that seem a little more fitting as to the establishment you're planning to go and enter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, we should have aliases. Can we have aliases?

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Yeah, I'll be Thorbir.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: I like it. It's easy to remember.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Very easy. Oh, you know what, maybe I could-- would it be weird if I'm Vex? That's weird, isn't it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's really weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's good?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Elivr is nice. Coralin.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, Coralin. Do I look like a Coralin?

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What does a Coralin look like?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: She does that. Just agree.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will be Scanlan Shorthalt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (stutters) What, you can be Scanlan, but I couldn't be Vex?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you can't do that. I'm just saying it's weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's double standard, Vax. I'm just saying.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I think it's maybe because you're not his sister and it would be weird because that's his sister's name.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: You have a sister?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a twin, yes.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What does she look like? Oh.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But she's a female.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: She sounds lovely.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: Humans, am I right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's very nice.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: That's what they say about all the ugly girls. "She's very nice."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like I'm learning so much from you. Is that what they say?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Life lessons, yes.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: Velvet Cabaret?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the Cabaret.

lines.name: WIL
lines.text: I presume that I'll play the role of your guard.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bodyguard, yes.

lines.name: WILL
lines.text: What does that make me? How about your valet? You'll need one if you're wealthy. Would you have a human, though?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course. Of course I'll have a human, being elven.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Are we on our way there now?

lines.name: LIAM
